title: Analysis and Application of Self-Regulated Learning Strategies in Online Collaborative Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic experience with online collaboration tools and foundational knowledge in language education
context.additional_context: A course where current practitioners learn self-regulated strategies applicable to real language education projects, facilitated through collaborative learning environments using personal devices.

learning_goals: Learners can visualize self-regulated learning processes in online collaborative environments through content analysis and ENA tools.
Learners can analyze high-performing groups' self-regulated learning patterns (content monitoring, evaluation, socio-emotional regulation) and apply them to their own teams.
Learners can progressively develop self-regulated learning strategies over an 8-week project period, improving team performance by over 20%.

resources: Online collaboration platforms (e.g., Slack, Google Workspace)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
